result.execSummary:
The defendant Bridgette M. Messa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.  Undercover purchase money in the amount of $2035.00 is ordered joint and several with co-defendants involved, Amanda Hopp, Ryan Van and/or Shawn Knaup.
Defendant to obtain and maintain gainful  full time employment.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is prohibited from having any contact with co-defendants, Amanda Hopp, Ryan Van and/or Shawn Knaup.
Defendant to comply with any further terms and/or conditions as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Huber Privileges granted.  No Good Time Credit.  Balance of sentence to be served forthwith.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 15CF-11 and 15CF-93 - Both Cases Called @ 1:38 PM:  Defendant Bridgette M. Messa in court, in custody, with attorney Caroline Ann Carver, both appearing in person.  Scott Blader appearing for the State of Wisconsin. Global resolution recited by DA w/argued terms on sentencing.  Def and counsel concur w/State's recital.  15CF-93:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Meds serving no impairment on proceeding today.   Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained.  Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  15CF-11 - Plea to Ct 1 of INFO - Plea:  NC.  Court accepts State's motion to amend as to 15CF-93 contrary to s. 940.19(1)(a) (Simple Battery) Plea:  NC  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC as to both counts.  Argument by DA.  John Messa (uncle) makes statement to the Court on Def's behalf.  Argument by Atty Carver - argues for lesser conditional time and supervision.  Further argument by DA.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:   15CF-93: 6 mos WCJ - I/S - No TS Credit, Huber and GT.  S/W - 1 yr probation. Conditions:  Complete AODA and any follow thru, the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, N/C w/S. Gumz.  Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP.  15CF-11:  S/W - 4 yrs probation.  Conditions:  335 days WCJ - 182 days TS credit, Huber, No GT credit, Release should be on Xmas Eve, 153 days left to serve; AODA and any follow thru;  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, any other terms as deemed appropriate by agent, including gainful employment; Costs of case, 15CF-93 DNA sample to be provided and expungement of DNA process explained thru DOJ; $2035 Undercover purchase money - joint/several w/co-defendants involved; no contact with A. Hopp, R. Van and/or S. Knaup.  Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Bridgette M. Messa in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Carver requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Caroline Ann Carver in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Carver requests plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on March 3, 2015 at 09:55 am.

Case Called @ 3:45 PM: Defendant Bridgette M. Messa in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ruth Zouski also present in Court as to unpaid financial responsibilities.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Per Atty Carver - requests court entertain waiver of pre-lim and have matter proceed to ARGN today.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Def BOT.  INFO filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   NGP received and entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 09:55 am.
from DA's Office with attached Buy Money Reibursement Request - $2035
Initial appearance on February 3, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 1:05 PM: Defendant Bridgette M. Messa in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Per SPD:  Eligibility confirmed for SPD services.  ADA argues for cash bond in the amount of $1000.00 w/conditions.  SPD argues for significantly lower cash bond and/opr signature bond.  IA  Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
